column5: Going to Canada for the first time and would like to hear if you guys think I will be equipped right. Not sure what Rod and line is best for jigging and trolling could use your suggestions. We are taking 1/4 and 3/8 oz leadheads in varity of colors and we bought some bottom bouncers with Lindy Rigs. We also have a assortment of Rapala Crankbaits. We are planning on having minnows and Nightcrawlers. We also have a 18 ft boat with GPS and Depth Finder and have ordered lake maps.We are fishing Lac Seul the last week of June out of the Ear Falls area. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

Arky:Since you said this was going to be your first trip to Ontario, you would probably benefit from a review of the fishing regulations. General regulations are available on-line at:http://www.mnr.gov.on.ca/MNR/pubs/fi...r2003_Info.pdfRegulations specific to the Lac Seul area are on-line at:http://www.mnr.gov.on.ca/MNR/pubs/fi...r2003_MapE.pdfAnother web site that provides good fishing advice for north western Ontario is http://www.justfishontario.com/disc54_toc.htmAs to your specific questions, I would recommend that you take along lighter jigs (e.g. 1/16 th and 1/8 th ounce) as well as the ones you mentioned. You should have 1,2 and 3 ounce bottom bouncer weights. Most of the time, you'll probably use 2 ounce weights to fish at 20 feet. You might also consider some very light wire hooks for drifting leeches. Have a good trip.
Hey, im going to white wing the same time think we talked before. I would get 8lb test for walleyes. Berekly TX is what I usally use. If you are gonna go for pike too I would get 20lb test fireline

Walleye Jigging - 6ft Rod- Medium Action- Graphite (IM6 or IM7)- 6lb Silver Thread fishing line.(Favorite jig head color is lime green)Walleye Crankbait Rod- 7ft Rod- Medium/Heavy Action- Graphite (IM6 or IM7)- 10lb Silver Thread(My favorite is #8 Pearl White Shad Rap)
Hey, That means there are going to be two groups of us Arkies there at the same time. Where are you from and where are you staying?

http://www.justfishontario.com/reports.htm has great fishing reports once the season starts. It will tell you what's going on.http://www.justfishontario.com/equipment_list1.htmA comprehensive list of suggested fishing equipment for northwestern Ontario.http://www.justfishontario.com/articles.htmSome great fishing articles by knowledgeable fisherman.
